SENT.plain: Obesity is a significant and potentially serious health problem in achondroplasia
Body mass indices, weight-to-square of the height ratio (W/H2), and triceps skinfold measurements show that obesity is common
It begins in early childhood and is prevalent at all ages

We recommend that weight be monitored closely in all persons with achondroplasia and that dietary intervention be instituted whenever the body mass indices, W/H2, and triceps skinfold measurements exceed the 95th centile for the general population
